channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Silver Lining for Trump in His Trade Policy Setbacks
item.description: Failing to achieve his desired tariff levels could inspire him to build a trade system that serves America and the free world — at China’s expense.

item.title: Hair dryers from drones and makeup mirrors from movie animators: How L’Oréal makes open innovation work
item.description: L’Oréal demonstrates that Europe is becoming an increasingly strong hub for innovation, especially in the area of open innovation.

item.title: Welker Blames Social Media For Kirk Assassination: All The Questions From Meet The Press
item.description: Welker never explored the dangerous ideology that is likely behind the murder, instead focusing blame on social media.

item.title: Charlie Kirk Respected You
item.description: How dark are the hearts that celebrate his murder? Where can we show light? Everywhere, every chance we get.

item.title: AI Will Destroy Entire Industries, and That’s a Good Thing
item.description: After each wave of innovation, our country has emerged more prosperous and economically capable. This time will be no different.

item.title: Investor who manages $900 million in assets says there’s one investing hack everyone should know: ‘I wish they would teach it more in high school’

item.title: China says Nvidia violated antitrust laws as it ratchets up pressure ahead of U.S. trade talks

item.title: Democrats Said Thoughts And Prayers Won’t Stop Leftist Violence, So Here Are Some Ideas
item.description: Pray — not just for comfort, but for courage and prudence to frustrate evil where it has taken individuals and institutions captive.

item.title: Drugmakers Have a Right to Advertise
item.description: The First Amendment applies to commercial speech as well as political speech.

item.title: Major Garrett Downplays Posts Celebrating Kirk’s Assassination: All The Questions From Face The Nation
item.description: Major Garrett appeared to downplay internet posts celebrating Charlie Kirk's assassination during this week's edition of 'Face The Nation.'

item.title: House Republican plans to leave Congress after more than 2 decades in office
item.description: Rep. Michael McCaul, a Texas Republican who has served in the U.S. House of Representatives since 2005, will not seek re-election in 2026.

item.title: How Roy Jakobs is leveraging Dutch directness and the power of AI to transform Philips into a health-tech leader
item.description: Roy Jakobs, who joined Philips in 2010 and became CEO in 2022 amid a major crisis, has since played a key role in stabilizing the company.

item.description: Martha Raddatz had one key question she asked every guest who was there to talk about the Charlie Kirk assassination. Who is to blame?

item.description: It's past time Republican leaders use every lawful mechanism to crack down on leftist violence plaguing the nation.
